ByggLogg.summary: Implementation and critical bugfix of copy/download functionality in the AI Context Builder's file preview modal.

actions.title: Initial Implementation of Modal Buttons

files.changeDescription: Added HTML buttons and initial JavaScript logic for copy/download within the file preview modal.

actions.result: Introduced a critical JavaScript TypeError that caused the application to break upon loading.

actions.title: Critical Bugfix and Defensive Coding

files.changeDescription: Implemented defensive null checks around DOM element access and event listener attachments to prevent TypeError.

actions.result: The application crash was resolved, and the file preview modal now loads stably. The copy and download buttons are functionally implemented for text files and download is enabled for image files.

actions.title: Help me God Protocol Execution
actions.changeDescription: Performed a rigorous internal audit using the 'Help me God' protocol to verify the robustness, architecture, and error resilience of the implemented changes.
actions.result: The code was deemed stable and correct, passing all validation gates, confirming the resolution of the critical bug and the proper functioning of the new features.

ByggLogg.projectStatus: The AI Context Builder tool is now stable and includes functional copy and download capabilities within its file preview modal. The core application remains stable and ready for further development.

interactions.speaker: Engrove (human:operator@unknown)
interactions.summary: Task: Implement copy and download buttons in the file preview modal of the AI Context Builder.

interactions.speaker: Frankensteen (Google:Gemini 2.5 Pro@2025-08-08)
interactions.summary: Provided a plan and code (v12.0) to add copy/download buttons to the modal, including HTML and JavaScript logic.

interactions.speaker: Engrove (human:operator@unknown)
interactions.summary: Reported that the previous update broke the application.

interactions.speaker: Frankensteen (Google:Gemini 2.5 Pro@2025-08-08)
interactions.summary: Apologized for breaking the app, diagnosed the issue as a TypeError, and provided a critical bugfix (v12.1) with defensive coding and G-PFC-1 validation.

interactions.speaker: Engrove (human:operator@unknown)
interactions.summary: Requested a 'Help me God' protocol review of the latest code changes.

interactions.speaker: Frankensteen (Google:Gemini 2.5 Pro@2025-08-08)
interactions.summary: Performed a 'Help me God' protocol review, confirming stability and correctness of the modal copy/download functionality and the previous critical bugfix.

ai_protocol_performance.aiQualitativeSummary: Initial implementation of new UI features led to a critical app crash due to DOM manipulation timing. A rapid, targeted debugging cycle (including a 'Help me God' review) successfully identified and resolved the core issue with defensive coding, restoring full functionality and feature implementation.

improvementSuggestion.pattern: Introduction of new DOM-manipulating JavaScript elements/features without sufficient defensive checks for element existence, leading to `TypeError` during page load/initialization.

identifiedRisk.description: Attempting to attach event listeners or manipulate DOM elements retrieved by `document.getElementById` or similar methods before the elements are fully parsed and available in the DOM, leading to `TypeError` (Cannot read properties of null).

mitigation.description: Always perform null/undefined checks on DOM elements retrieved via `document.getElementById` or similar methods before attempting to access their properties or attach event listeners. E.g., `if (element) { element.addEventListener(...) }`.
